choices: Child (male or female, human or monster)
1.content:
The time, between 1850-1900. The place, somewhere in the Old West.

As you go about your day in town, you take a look in a reflection of yourself, and see that you are a...
1.title: Welcome to the Old West.

choices: Cowboy, in town to relaxe after a long drive
Outlaw, planning some sort of crime
11.content: What sort of person are you?
11.title: Adult Male monster

111.content: A dangerous an sometimes unlawful staple of the west, what are you?
111.title: Hardworking cowboy

1111.content: Anything can happen in the Wild West, especially if a lack of human comfort is involved.
1111.title: hybrid species

11111.content: Seems like you're closer to the nature of the west than most other people. What are you?
11111.title: A big ol' taur

choices: Search for a meal on the dusty road
111111.content:
Wesley wasn’t a monster. The fact that he often devoured people alive shouldn’t put that kind of label on him, it was downright unfair. It had already been over an hour since he’d devoured his last victim, and it seemed like an eternity. The farmer had stopped struggling after about fifteen minutes, but that was nature. And it took a lot of people every day just to fuel his huge centaur body.

Wes stifled a belch. That was probably one of the farmer’s stablehands disagreeing with him. It was only 9:00 AM and already four humans had made the final plunge into his horsebelly where they were swiftly broken down. Suddenly, the centaur’s belly let out a loud rumble.

“Huh? Greedy thing, you haven’t even finished on the people from this morning. Well, I suppose I’m happy to comply...”
111111.title: Centaurs all the way!

1111113.content:
Soon enough, Wesley saw a town in the distance. He wasn't sure what it was called, but any place would do, for him to get a meal, and maybe a snack, or two.

Eventually, he came upon a tiger-like creature sitting in a chair. Pinned to his shirt was a yellow star. Next to him, was a double-barrel shotgun, of a size that would give Wesley some trouble, if he didn't mind his manners.

"Morning, Sheriff," said Wesley.

The tiger looked at him. "I ain't the Sheriff, otherwise I'd be in the jailhouse, watching the prisoner. He doesn't want me there, on account of how I might make things personal between me and them, especially since the little bastard knocked out three of my teeth."

"I'm surprised that you didn't eat this person that caused you such an annoyance," said Wesley.

The tiger looked at him more closely. "How many, and where did you eat them at?"

"Four, and from a farm up the road a ways," said Wesley. "Why do you care about that?"

The tiger pointed at a poster. "Did they look like them?"

Wesley looked. "Yes. I had all four of them for breakfast."

The tiger grinned. "Karma's a real bitch. Those bastards poisoned thirty pigs at the town picnic, and got a lot of folks sick. No deaths, luckily, so we just kicked them out of town, with the understanding that if they came back here, anyone would be allowed to eat them, without paying the fee."

"Fee?" Wesley asked.

"The mayor's a greedy old lizard," the tiger said. "That dragon figures that each human pays about five hundred dollars a year, in taxes, and figures since a human can live about fifty years, if they are lucky, each human is worth twenty-five thousand dollars in revenue, at the very least. Eat a human, and you need to pay that money, either up front, or over fifty years. Humans like this, because it reduces the odds they'll get eaten, and if a monster does eat them, then the monster pays the taxes in their place."

"What about the monsters that live here?" Wesley asked.

"There's plenty of alternatives for meat, and cheaper as well," the tiger said. "Most don't mind, and them that do, better have the money to pay, for each human that they eat."

"Suppose someone was to eat and run?" Wesley asked.

The tiger grinned. "Then they'd be guilty of stealing twenty-five thousand dollars, and have to pay with something other than money. The Mayor likes to eat such thieves, although he does show some mercy, if the human is recovered alive, and merely snaps their neck, instead of roasting them alive, before eating them."

"Never heard of any place having such a law," said Wesley.

"Like I said," the tiger said. "The lizard is a greedy one. Of course, the saloon has good food, the brothel has good whores, there's a bathhouse that does a good job if you need to wash up, and the general store is full of supplies. Just remember, no money, no humans."

"I'll keep that in mind," said Wesley.
1111113.title: Strange Town

choices: Wesley decides to wait in the saloon.
Wesley decides to visit the general store
Wesley decides to visit the Sheriff for his reward
11111131.content:
It was at this moment that Wesley's stomach grumbled once more.

The tiger chuckled. "Sounds like you might want to visit the saloon." He took the Wanted poster off the fence, and gave it to Wesley. "By the way, you did pick up something that belonged to those no-goods, right?"

"Yeah," Wesley said. He carefully pulled a pearl-handled revolver out of his pack. "The one threatened me with this." He tossed it to the tiger.

The tiger took a look. "That's Colm's revolver alright." He tossed it back. "If you're short on money, show that to the barkeep, and he'll send someone to get the Sheriff. You let him see that, and he won't ask you no questions about the details. After that, you'll have yourself plenty of money for a meal - just no humans, or any other sentient peoples."

"How much are we talking about?" Wesley asked.

"Two hundred for Colm, plus fifty each for the other three, and another hundred for all four of the bastards," said the tiger. "I do hope you have some of their personal effects."

"Well, I did pick up a few things, as it wasn't like they'd need them anymore," said Wesley. "Might have a few more things later."

"Make sure to clean them before you try to pawn them off," the tiger said. "You might want to keep the revolver though, as that is a fine weapon."

"Alright," said Wesley. "See you when I leave."

"Enjoy your time here," said the tiger. "Just don't cause no trouble."


Soon enough, Wesley entered the saloon. While the place had plenty of dancing girls, and plenty of patrons, the one thing that surprised him were the number of humans, and the fact that none of them were going down someone's throat. That being said, the food that was being served smelled good, even if it didn't have human served with it, and the portions were generous, to say nothing about the fact that one of the more burly servers brought a raw deer to one of the more carnivorous sorts, among other things for their table guests, like a raw sheep, and a raw pig.

Wesley walked up to the bar.

"What will it be?" the barkeeper asked.

"Do you have beer?" Wesley asked.

The barkeeper pulled out a couple of bottles. "That will be a dollar."

Wesley put some money on the counter. "What would you recommend for someone with a good sized-appetite?"

"If you want it raw, we have deer, sheep, goat, pig, and sides of beef," the barkeeper said. "If you want it cooked, you'll have to wait a bit."

"What if I have some business elsewhere?" Wesley asked. "Could I order, walk out, do my business, then come back to enjoy my meal?"

"So long as your business doesn't get you locked up," the barkeeper said. "Give me an order, and I'll give you this chip." The barkeeper got out a token. "Cooking usually takes twenty minutes, but if you aren't here within an hour, we give it to someone else who is here, and has the money to pay for it, at a reduced rate of course."

"Alright," said Wesley. "In that case, chili with beef meat, plus a quarter each of sheep, goat, pig, and deer, cooked."

"Very well," the barkeeper said. He opened up a window behind him and called out the order. "So, waiting here or do you wish to conduct some other business?"
11111131.title: Wesley visits the Saloon

choices: The Werewolf Sheriff washing the Human Prisoner
The Werewolf Sheriff working on his books
That someone was waiting for the Sheriff
That the Human Prisoner was there, all alone.
111111313.content:
"Well, seems that there was a bounty on this fella who decided to get on the wrong side of me," said Wesley. "Someone by the name of Colm."

The bartender looked up. "Did he have a pearl-handled revolver?"

Wesley nodded.

The bartender scoffed. "He always was a show off. Didn't like monsters, so he tried to poison those in the one place folks don't normally eat humans. Guess he didn't learn his lesson."

"That's one way of putting it," said Wesley.

"Just don't eat any humans while you're in town," the barkeep said. "If you have an issue with someone, talk to the Sheriff about it."

"Alright," Wesley said. "See you in a bit."

Wesley took a chip and walked out of the saloon. He then headed over to the Sheriff's office where he saw....
111111313.title: Wesley decides to visit the Sheriff for his reward

1113.content: Riding through the open range, dust blowing in your fur, what are you?
1113.title: Some sort of fur

113.content: So, what is your Profession?
113.title: Profession

1131.content: So, you are a Lawman. Who are you?
1131.title: Lawman

11311.content: So, your Character's a Sheriff. What race is he?
11311.title: Sheriff

113111.content:
Sheriff Greyfur woke up, the sunlight in his eyes. He got out of his cot, and looked across at the cell in front of him. In it, was a human, who was, more or less, recovering from having something too strong for him to drink.

The werewolf stood up, grabbed a bucket, walked over to the cell, and tossed the contents on the human.

The human woke up sputtering. "What the-"

"Be glad that's just water, and not something else."

The human looked at him, and groaned. "My head hurts."

"Guzzling down Fredrick's Firewater will do that to you," said Greyfur. "Now, come here."

The human walked forward.

"Put your arms through the bars."

The human did so, and Greyfur tied his hands together. He then opened the door, and stepped inside, where he lifted the human's shirt, and dropped their pants.

"Just get it over with," the human said. "You're just going to eat me afterwards."

"Don't tempt me with that proposition," said Greyfur. "Besides, I'm not going to rape you; I'm going to wash you."

"And, just what are you going to- AHHHH That Stings! What are you doing? Pissing on me?"

"You wish," said Greyfur. "Hot water and soap, not to mention a washcloth."

"It shouldn't hurt like that," the human muttered.

"I should have the Doc look at you," said Greyfur. "You're all covered in bruises and such."

"Why should you care?" the human asked. "You're just going to eat me anyways."

"We have an ordinance that's against that," said Greyfur. "Except for certain exceptions, but, thankfully for you, getting drunk, and punching my Deputy isn't one of them, although he wishes it was. As it is, you're going to be stuck here for a month, cleaning the place out; Doc had to pull three of Charlie's teeth out, and he hates that."

"Damn cat snuck up on me," said the human.

"Cats do that," said Greyfur. "Didn't give you the right to hit him. Anyplace else, you'd be dead by now, if not worse."

"Like I give a damn," the human said. "You monsters control everything, and never let humans do what they want."

"Doesn't give you an excuse for breaking the law," said Greyfur, as he finished washing the human. He then grabbed a dry towel, and started rubbing the human down.

"I can wash and dry myself," the human said.

"Maybe if you behave yourself," said Greyfur. He soon finished, took the stuff out of the cell, closed the door, and untied the human.

The human redressed himself, and went back to his cot.

"What's your name?"

The human looked at him. "John, not that you care about it."

"Last name?"

The human looked at the cell wall on the other side of him. "Let's just leave it at Smith."

Greyfur nodded. "Alright, John Smith. Now, if you were better behaved, I might let you call me Richard, or Rich, or even Dick, but, until then, Sheriff Greyfur is what you'll address me as, or just plain Sheriff."

"How about if I called you Son of a Bitch?"

Greyfur shook his head. "Let's leave my mother out of this."

He then left the office, and looked around. He looked over at the saloon, which was playing some rather bawdy music. He looked at the brothel, which always had a woman available for him. He then looked over at a traveling medicine salesbeast, which was drawing quite a crowd, with plenty of claims about what their elixirs did.

He went towards.....
113111.title: Sheriff Greyfur

1131112.content:
Greyfur walked towards the brothel. Granted, it was still a little early in the day, but he felt like paying a visit was a good start to the day. Besides, the place had a good bath, and for a little extra, someone could help out, and for a bit more, the bath was big enough for two, for the most part.

As he walked in, Greyfur saw the big red dragoness in the front room. "Madam."

The dragoness smiled as she looked at him. "A pleasure to see you this morning Richard. What may I offer you?"

"How about a good bath for starters," said Greyfur. "After I get in, send in Tilly, if they are available. If not, Sam will do."

The dragoness chuckled. "Sharing the bath again?"

"You'll hear if I do," said Greyfur.

"I'm surprised that you never ask for me," the dragoness said.

"Your husband doesn't pay me enough to call on your services," said Greyfur. "Besides, I like humans."

"And female or male doesn't matter to you," the dragoness said.

"I'll let you know when to send them in," said Greyfur.


Soon enough, Greyfur was enjoying a hot bath. It was a great way to relax, and he was glad that there was at least one of these things in town, let alone five. It wasn't unheard of for someone to come into the place just to take a bath in one of them, even bringing their family in with them, especially for some big event in town. The dragoness didn't mind, so long as she got paid. Of course, there were a few other baths in town, but this place had people willing to help out those bathing.

The door knocked. "Your helper is here."

"Come in," said Greyfur.

In came .....
1131112.title: The Brothel

choices: Settles for the regular Deluxe bath, with her scrubbing him.
Orders the Extra Deluxe bath, and watches her disrobe
Just pulls her into the tub with him
11311121.content:
Greyfur watched as Tilly came in. She had light colored skin, red hair, a few freckles, a good figure, and, as an added bonus, all of her teeth.

"Good to see you," he said, as she came up to him.

"It's nice to see you as well, Sheriff," the woman said, as she started working on his shoulder.

"You have a healing touch, Tilly," Greyfur said, as he felt his muscles relax. "Might hire you out to help me with a prisoner, if he behaves himself."

"The fella from the other night?" Tilly asked. "Seemed like your average drunk to me."

"Seems he's had a few difficulties out there," said Greyfur. "At least here he's just locked up, and not down someone's gullet."

"Kind of prefer being here myself," said Tilly. "Folks don't eat you here for no good reason at any rate."

"Although it can be rather tempting," said Greyfur. "Wouldn't mind enjoying you myself."

Tilly chuckled. "That would cost you extra."

"And it would be worth it," said Greyfur, with a grin.

"Let me know if you want me to take my clothes off, so that I can give you the Extra Deluxe service," said Tilly.

At this, Greyfur....
11311121.title: Tilly, a woman

11313.content: How about a position in the prestigious Pinkerton National Detective Agency?
11313.title: Lawman, Cont.

113131.content:

Now tell me, what race are you?
113131.title: Pinkerton's Private Police

153.content:
You don't have a name and were orphaned as a baby. No one in town takes notice that you exist. You work in the whore house cleaning up and even the women treat you badly. The only food you get is scraps and you sleep in a dirty attic. You know that one day you will work in the brothel as a whore.

One night when you are taking out the trash and you hear a strange thud. You decide to. . . . .
153.title: Female, human

info.brief_description: What do you get when you cross a cowboy with a monster? A Monster Cowboy. 1,640+ views
info.description:
Based off of my Monster Cowboys series, "Monster Cowboys The Book" , you take the reins of someone in this Western/fantasy-style interactive, in which humans, monsters, technology and magic live side by side in the Old West. You could be anyone you want, from a cowboy driving cattle to market, and battling rustlers, to a townsperson in a western town, to an outlaw who preys on the hard working and honest folk, to a Native American watching as Anglo-American Monsters and humans encroach on your tribe's traditional hunting lands. You could have a code of some sort, like that you don't eat women and children, or some such thing, or you could be downright evil, and do just that.

Now, here are the rules.

1. Terms of the 19th century are allowed, including those that are considered derogatory today, though try not to use them to excess.

2. If it existed in the Old West, it's allowed, like whorehouses.

3. Technology must be 19th century in style and such. So, when it comes to cameras and guns, no Kodaks, and no Uzis.

4. Sex is allowed, but try to keep it casual, be it gay/lesbian, or straight.

5. Vore is allowed, but try to give a reason for the person to do it, like the person is some sort of outlaw, or they did it to protect someone that they care about.

6. You can be any monster you want, or even a human, including those with some sort of magic.

7. Story is to be in the third person.

8. Always give alternatives for different characters, especially for the different types of monsters.

Well, get along little doggies.
